results.title: The Bridge
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
“The Bridge” is a celebration of a childhood sense of place and belonging to the filmmakers’ birthplace, Warrandyte by video artist John Hipwell. Created to celebrate the artists’ early nexus with the neighbourhood, landscape and ambience of Warrandyte and its surrounds. “The Bridge” over the Yarra River also symbolises the journey from childhood to manhood. The Visaural (video painting with sound scape) is made up of 8 x 30 sec. short films each representing an important particular place central to the artists’ maturation. When played conitnuously and randomly “The Bridge” becomes a metaphor for the filmmakers’ early journey of adventure, discovery and development.
The titles are:
1. Home, Presbyterian Church and The Bridge
2. Gold mines, Petrol Station and The Bridge
3. Research Look Out, Monsalvat and The Bridge
4. Primary School, Folk Art and The Bridge
5. Creek, Yarra River and The Bridge
6. Moonlight Cottage, Potters Cottage and The Bridge
7. War Memorial, Car wrecks and The Bridge
8. Bush fire, North Warrandyte Fire Brigade and The Bridge
Music composed by John B. Hipwell (John Hipwell’s father)
and cinematography and editing by Adis Hondo.

results.title: Dottie gets spanked
results.brief_description: Todd Haynes’ black comedy is set in 1950s suburbia where the TV heroine Dottie reigns supreme. When a young boy gets his chance to meet his idol, the series of events he witnesses transforms his fantasy life. This is where childhood’s end begins.

results.title: Journey into tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Victorian Railways and Fortune Film Productions
results.brief_description: The story of the duplication and electrification of the Gippsland line to Yallourn and Traralgon. Shows its effect on the communities that look to the railway to bring them better living, more goods and greater service, and to take their products swiftly to market.

results.title: Cyberthon III: The Underground Connection [1-hour compilation]
results.brief_description:
‘Cyberthon III: The Underground Connection’ was the third broadcast event in the Cyberthon series, held at TVU’s (Television Unlimited) warehouse and studio in Footscray Victoria. Increasing again in scope and complexity from Cyberthon II, Cyberthon III collaborators invited ten local bands, ten local DJ’s and 3RRR radio hosts Kate Bathgate and Liz Miller to interview artists and participants live at the event. This was in addition to the extensive DJ and VJ sets, live artist performances, electronic art and installations on displays. Viewers were also encouraged to interact with participating artists via a bulletin board system (BBS) or fax in a Cyberthon event first.

This one-hour compilation was created a month after the event from nine hours of footage and subsequently aired July 12, 1992.

Visual Artists: Tekno Mandala (Adem Jaffers), Cyber Dada (Dale Nason and Troy Innocent), Don’t Shoot the Messenger (Steve Middleton and Attillio Gangemi), Force Fed (Stuart McCormick & Michael Brand), Video Graffiti (Andrew Nelson)

Audio Artists: Darren Jackson (Geeza), Braden Schlager & Miles du Heaume (1x4x9), Soulscraper (Chris Dubrow, Sarah Lord, James Lynch, Elanor Rayner & Jim Shnookal), H2o (Terence Ho ), Vertigo Hypo (Bryan St James & Narelle Wellington), 2120 (Claude Young Jr), Hardware (Richie ‘Rich’ McNeil), Poets of the Machine (Coral and Stripe), The Visitor (Andrew Till), Liz Millar, This Digital Ocean (Liz Millar, Ross Healy & Simon Bowley), Magnetic Head Circuit (Chubba, Matt Bastard, Peter Randall), Blast Off Sound System (Jason ‘Rudeboy’ Mac), Miss Baby Lemonade Lemarr (Andrea), Mish Fingers (Misha Hollenbach), Whip (Kent Morris, Michelle, Mirella, Simon), Geeza (Darren Jackson), Wesley McDonald

Performers: Tranzmission (Kate Bathgate), Liz Millar, Every Picture Tells a Story (Hydi John), Central Station (Joe Polumbo), Yoga (Mary Galick, Eugene-NRG (Paul Gafney) & Bronwyn Richie), Mad Club (Bernie Grogan, Danny Slim, Susan Clinch & Matt the Tree), Taz (Tasilim Emiabata), Star (Raquel Webb), Lizette Broulathaki and Jynell Dolan.

results.title: The Talented Mr. Ripley [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Miramax Films, William Horberg, Tom Sternberg and Anthony Minghella
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Patricia Highsmith, The Talented Mr. Ripley is a story about a charismatic sociopath who would rather be a ‘fake somebody than a real nobody’.

constellations_other.name: Quiet luxury and loud transformations
constellations_other.description: In The Dressmaker, Gertrude (Sarah Snook) transforms from 'dowdy' to elegant when she attends a dance in this dress. It's a popular cinema trope that shows how characters develop, but the 'makeover' trope isn't always a positive.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Paramount Pictures, Miramax Films, William Horberg, Tom Sternberg and Anthony Minghella
results.description: Based on the novel by Patricia Highsmith, “The Talented Mr. Ripley” is a story about a charismatic sociopath who would rather be a ‘fake somebody than a real nobody’. Living and working in New York as a washroom attendant, Tom Ripley is faced with an opportunity he cannot refuse when a wealthy shipping tycoon mistakes him for a Princeton classmate of his son, Dickie. He proposes that Tom go to Italy in an attempt to bring his playboy son back home. When Tom finds and befriends both Dickie and is girlfriend, neither are aware the extremes Tom will go to in order to claim their lives as his own. Cast includes: Matt Damon, Gwyneth Paltrow, Jude Law, Philip Seymour Hoffman and Cate Blanchett.
description_for_label: Based on the novel by Patricia Highsmith, “The Talented Mr. Ripley” is a story about a charismatic sociopath who would rather be a ‘fake somebody than a real nobody’. Living and working in New York as a washroom attendant, Tom Ripley is faced with an opportunity he cannot refuse when a wealthy shipping tycoon mistakes him for a Princeton classmate of his son, Dickie. He proposes that Tom go to Italy in an attempt to bring his playboy son back home. When Tom finds and befriends both Dickie and is girlfriend, neither are aware the extremes Tom will go to in order to claim their lives as his own. Cast includes: Matt Damon, Gwyneth Paltrow, Jude Law, Philip Seymour Hoffman and Cate Blanchett.

results.title: The Breakfast club
results.creator_credit: John Hughes, Ned Tanen and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: John Hughes wrote and directed this film which was to become the quintessential high school drama of the 80s. Claire, the princess; Andrew, the jock; John, the criminal; Brian, the nerdy brain; and Alison, the basket case are all faced with spending nine hours together in Saturday detention. They begin the day as strangers having nothing in common, but as the day progresses, they slowly develop a bond in recognising that they are not as different as their places in the high school caste system would have them believe. Cast includes: Emilio Estevez, Judd Nelson, Molly Ringwald, Anthony Michael Hall, Ally Sheedy and Paul Gleason.

results.brief_description: A program in which international cricketers demonstrate the essential skills of the game. “The Cricket Coaching Clinic” is designed to instruct and motivate young and old, the uninitiated and the experienced.

results.title: High and wild
results.creator_credit: David Greig and Kestrel Films & Video (Australia)
results.brief_description: High and Wild is the latest video from the Wilderness Society’s ongoing education program. It traces the journey of eight students and their teacher from Melbourne’s Kingswood College on what, for most, was their first wilderness experience. Shot on location in Victoria’s Wonnangatta-Moroka National Park “High and Wild” captures the students’ experience as they explore a variety of issues surrounding wilderness - such as alpine grazing logging, flora/fauna protection, outdoor recreation, Aboriginal and World Heritage values.
